parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique token that Amazon SES uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: RuleSetName
parameters.description: A user-friendly name for the rule set.

parameters.name: Rules
parameters.description: Conditional rules that are evaluated for determining actions on email. (dict) --- A rule contains conditions, 'unless conditions' and actions. For each envelope recipient of an email, if all conditions match and none of the 'unless conditions' match, then all of the actions are executed sequentially. If no conditions are provided, the rule always applies and the actions are implicitly executed. If only 'unless conditions' are provided, the rule applies if the email does not match the evaluation of the 'unless conditions'. The list of actions to execute when the conditions match the incoming email, and none of the 'unless conditions' match. (dict) --- The action for a rule to take. Only one of the contained actions can be set. AddHeader (dict) --- This action adds a header. This can be used to add arbitrary email headers. The name of the header to add to an email. The header must be prefixed with 'X-'. Headers are added regardless of whether the header name pre-existed in the email. The value of the header to add to the email. Archive (dict) --- This action archives the email. This can be used to deliver an email to an archive. ActionFailurePolicy (string) --- A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the specified archive has been deleted. The identifier of the archive to send the email to. DeliverToMailbox (dict) --- This action delivers an email to a WorkMail mailbox. For example, the mailbox ARN is no longer valid. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a WorkMail organization to deliver the email to. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role to use to execute this action. The role must have access to the workmail:DeliverToMailbox API. DeliverToQBusiness (dict) --- This action delivers an email to an Amazon Q Business application for ingestion into its knowledge base. For example, the specified application has been deleted or the role lacks necessary permissions to call the qbusiness:BatchPutDocument API. The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business application instance where the email content will be delivered. The identifier of the knowledge base index within the Amazon Q Business application where the email content will be stored and indexed. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to use while delivering to Amazon Q Business. This role must have access to the qbusiness:BatchPutDocument API for the given application and index. Drop (dict) --- This action terminates the evaluation of rules in the rule set. PublishToSns (dict) --- This action publishes the email content to an Amazon SNS topic. For example, specified SNS topic has been deleted or the role lacks necessary permissions to call the sns:Publish API. Encoding (string) --- The encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification. The default value is UTF-8. Use BASE64 if you need to preserve all special characters, especially when the original message uses a different encoding format. PayloadType (string) --- The expected payload type within the Amazon SNS notification. CONTENT attempts to publish the full email content with 20KB of headers content. HEADERS extracts up to 100KB of header content to include in the notification, email content will not be included to the notification. The default value is CONTENT. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to use while writing to Amazon SNS. This role must have access to the sns:Publish API for the given topic. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS Topic to which notification for the email received will be published. Relay (dict) --- This action relays the email to another SMTP server. For example, the specified relay has been deleted. MailFrom (string) --- This action specifies whether to preserve or replace original mail from address while relaying received emails to a destination server. The identifier of the relay resource to be used when relaying an email. ReplaceRecipient (dict) --- The action replaces certain or all recipients with a different set of recipients. ReplaceWith (list) --- This action specifies the replacement recipient email addresses to insert. (string) --- Send (dict) --- This action sends the email to the internet. For example, the caller does not have the permissions to call the sendRawEmail API. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to use for this action. This role must have access to the ses:SendRawEmail API. WriteToS3 (dict) --- This action writes the MIME content of the email to an S3 bucket. For example, the specified the bucket has been deleted. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to use while writing to S3. This role must have access to the s3:PutObject, kms:Encrypt, and kms:GenerateDataKey APIs for the given bucket. The bucket name of the S3 bucket to write to. S3Prefix (string) --- The S3 prefix to use for the write to the s3 bucket. S3SseKmsKeyId (string) --- The KMS Key ID to use to encrypt the message in S3. Conditions (list) --- The conditions of this rule. All conditions must match the email for the actions to be executed. An empty list of conditions means that all emails match, but are still subject to any 'unless conditions' (dict) --- The conditional expression used to evaluate an email for determining if a rule action should be taken. BooleanExpression (dict) --- The condition applies to a boolean expression passed in this field. The operand on which to perform a boolean condition operation. Analysis (dict) --- The Add On ARN and its returned value to evaluate in a boolean condition expression. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Add On. The returned value from an Add On. Attribute (string) --- The boolean type representing the allowed attribute types for an email. IsInAddressList (dict) --- The structure representing the address lists and address list attribute that will be used in evaluation of boolean expression. The address lists that will be used for evaluation. (string) --- The email attribute that needs to be evaluated against the address list. The matching operator for a boolean condition expression. DmarcExpression (dict) --- The condition applies to a DMARC policy expression passed in this field. The operator to apply to the DMARC policy of the incoming email. The values to use for the given DMARC policy operator. For the operator EQUALS, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an OR. That is, if any of the given values match, the condition is deemed to match. For the operator NOT_EQUALS, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an AND. That is, only if the email's DMARC policy is not equal to any of the given values, then the condition is deemed to match. (string) --- IpExpression (dict) --- The condition applies to an IP address expression passed in this field. The IP address to evaluate in this condition. Attribute (string) --- The attribute of the email to evaluate. The operator to evaluate the IP address. The IP CIDR blocks in format 'x.y.z.w/n' (eg 10.0.0.0/8) to match with the email's IP address. For the operator CIDR_MATCHES, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an OR. That is, if the IP address is contained within any of the given CIDR ranges, the condition is deemed to match. For NOT_CIDR_MATCHES, if multiple CIDR ranges are given, the condition is deemed to match if the IP address is not contained in any of the given CIDR ranges. (string) --- NumberExpression (dict) --- The condition applies to a number expression passed in this field. The number to evaluate in a numeric condition expression. Attribute (string) --- An email attribute that is used as the number to evaluate. The operator for a numeric condition expression. The value to evaluate in a numeric condition expression. StringExpression (dict) --- The condition applies to a string expression passed in this field. The string to evaluate in a string condition expression. Analysis (dict) --- The Add On ARN and its returned value to evaluate in a string condition expression. Attribute (string) --- The email attribute to evaluate in a string condition expression. MimeHeaderAttribute (string) --- The email MIME X-Header attribute to evaluate in a string condition expression. The matching operator for a string condition expression. The string(s) to be evaluated in a string condition expression. For all operators, except for NOT_EQUALS, if multiple values are given, the values are processed as an OR. That is, if any of the values match the email's string using the given operator, the condition is deemed to match. However, for NOT_EQUALS, the condition is only deemed to match if none of the given strings match the email's string. (string) --- VerdictExpression (dict) --- The condition applies to a verdict expression passed in this field. The verdict to evaluate in a verdict condition expression. Analysis (dict) --- The Add On ARN and its returned value to evaluate in a verdict condition expression. Attribute (string) --- The email verdict attribute to evaluate in a string verdict expression. The matching operator for a verdict condition expression. The values to match with the email's verdict using the given operator. For the EQUALS operator, if multiple values are given, the condition is deemed to match if any of the given verdicts match that of the email. For the NOT_EQUALS operator, if multiple values are given, the condition is deemed to match of none of the given verdicts match the verdict of the email. (string) --- Name (string) --- The user-friendly name of the rule. Unless (list) --- The 'unless conditions' of this rule. None of the conditions can match the email for the actions to be executed. If any of these conditions do match the email, then the actions are not executed. (dict) --- The conditional expression used to evaluate an email for determining if a rule action should be taken. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Actions
nested_params.description: The list of actions to execute when the conditions match the incoming email, and none of the 'unless conditions' match.

nested_params.name: AddHeader
nested_params.description: This action adds a header. This can be used to add arbitrary email headers.

nested_params.name: HeaderName
nested_params.description: The name of the header to add to an email. The header must be prefixed with 'X-'. Headers are added regardless of whether the header name pre-existed in the email.

nested_params.name: HeaderValue
nested_params.description: The value of the header to add to the email.

nested_params.name: Archive
nested_params.description: This action archives the email. This can be used to deliver an email to an archive.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the specified archive has been deleted.

nested_params.name: TargetArchive
nested_params.description: The identifier of the archive to send the email to.

nested_params.name: DeliverToMailbox
nested_params.description: This action delivers an email to a WorkMail mailbox.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the mailbox ARN is no longer valid.

nested_params.name: MailboxArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a WorkMail organization to deliver the email to.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role to use to execute this action. The role must have access to the workmail:DeliverToMailbox API.

nested_params.name: DeliverToQBusiness
nested_params.description: This action delivers an email to an Amazon Q Business application for ingestion into its knowledge base.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the specified application has been deleted or the role lacks necessary permissions to call the qbusiness:BatchPutDocument API.

nested_params.name: ApplicationId
nested_params.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business application instance where the email content will be delivered.

nested_params.name: IndexId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the knowledge base index within the Amazon Q Business application where the email content will be stored and indexed.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to use while delivering to Amazon Q Business. This role must have access to the qbusiness:BatchPutDocument API for the given application and index.

nested_params.name: Drop
nested_params.description: This action terminates the evaluation of rules in the rule set.

nested_params.name: PublishToSns
nested_params.description: This action publishes the email content to an Amazon SNS topic.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, specified SNS topic has been deleted or the role lacks necessary permissions to call the sns:Publish API.

nested_params.name: Encoding
nested_params.description: The encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification. The default value is UTF-8. Use BASE64 if you need to preserve all special characters, especially when the original message uses a different encoding format.

nested_params.name: PayloadType
nested_params.description: The expected payload type within the Amazon SNS notification. CONTENT attempts to publish the full email content with 20KB of headers content. HEADERS extracts up to 100KB of header content to include in the notification, email content will not be included to the notification. The default value is CONTENT.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to use while writing to Amazon SNS. This role must have access to the sns:Publish API for the given topic.

nested_params.name: TopicArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS Topic to which notification for the email received will be published.

nested_params.name: Relay
nested_params.description: This action relays the email to another SMTP server.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the specified relay has been deleted.

nested_params.name: MailFrom
nested_params.description: This action specifies whether to preserve or replace original mail from address while relaying received emails to a destination server.

nested_params.name: Relay
nested_params.description: The identifier of the relay resource to be used when relaying an email.

nested_params.name: ReplaceRecipient
nested_params.description: The action replaces certain or all recipients with a different set of recipients.

nested_params.name: ReplaceWith
nested_params.description: This action specifies the replacement recipient email addresses to insert.

nested_params.name: Send
nested_params.description: This action sends the email to the internet.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the caller does not have the permissions to call the sendRawEmail API.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to use for this action. This role must have access to the ses:SendRawEmail API.

nested_params.name: WriteToS3
nested_params.description: This action writes the MIME content of the email to an S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: ActionFailurePolicy
nested_params.description: A policy that states what to do in the case of failure. The action will fail if there are configuration errors. For example, the specified the bucket has been deleted.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to use while writing to S3. This role must have access to the s3:PutObject, kms:Encrypt, and kms:GenerateDataKey APIs for the given bucket.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: The bucket name of the S3 bucket to write to.

nested_params.name: S3Prefix
nested_params.description: The S3 prefix to use for the write to the s3 bucket.

nested_params.name: S3SseKmsKeyId
nested_params.description: The KMS Key ID to use to encrypt the message in S3.

nested_params.name: Conditions
nested_params.description: The conditions of this rule. All conditions must match the email for the actions to be executed. An empty list of conditions means that all emails match, but are still subject to any 'unless conditions'

nested_params.name: BooleanExpression
nested_params.description: The condition applies to a boolean expression passed in this field.

nested_params.name: Evaluate
nested_params.description: The operand on which to perform a boolean condition operation.

nested_params.name: Analysis
nested_params.description: The Add On ARN and its returned value to evaluate in a boolean condition expression.

nested_params.name: Analyzer
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Add On.

nested_params.name: ResultField
nested_params.description: The returned value from an Add On.

nested_params.name: Attribute
nested_params.description: The boolean type representing the allowed attribute types for an email.

nested_params.name: IsInAddressList
nested_params.description: The structure representing the address lists and address list attribute that will be used in evaluation of boolean expression.

nested_params.name: AddressLists
nested_params.description: The address lists that will be used for evaluation.

nested_params.name: Attribute
nested_params.description: The email attribute that needs to be evaluated against the address list.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The matching operator for a boolean condition expression.

nested_params.name: DmarcExpression
nested_params.description: The condition applies to a DMARC policy expression passed in this field.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The operator to apply to the DMARC policy of the incoming email.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: The values to use for the given DMARC policy operator. For the operator EQUALS, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an OR. That is, if any of the given values match, the condition is deemed to match. For the operator NOT_EQUALS, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an AND. That is, only if the email's DMARC policy is not equal to any of the given values, then the condition is deemed to match.

nested_params.name: IpExpression
nested_params.description: The condition applies to an IP address expression passed in this field.

nested_params.name: Evaluate
nested_params.description: The IP address to evaluate in this condition.

nested_params.name: Attribute
nested_params.description: The attribute of the email to evaluate.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The operator to evaluate the IP address.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: The IP CIDR blocks in format 'x.y.z.w/n' (eg 10.0.0.0/8) to match with the email's IP address. For the operator CIDR_MATCHES, if multiple values are given, they are evaluated as an OR. That is, if the IP address is contained within any of the given CIDR ranges, the condition is deemed to match. For NOT_CIDR_MATCHES, if multiple CIDR ranges are given, the condition is deemed to match if the IP address is not contained in any of the given CIDR ranges.

nested_params.name: NumberExpression
nested_params.description: The condition applies to a number expression passed in this field.

nested_params.name: Evaluate
nested_params.description: The number to evaluate in a numeric condition expression.

nested_params.name: Attribute
nested_params.description: An email attribute that is used as the number to evaluate.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The operator for a numeric condition expression.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value to evaluate in a numeric condition expression.

nested_params.name: StringExpression
nested_params.description: The condition applies to a string expression passed in this field.

nested_params.name: Evaluate
nested_params.description: The string to evaluate in a string condition expression.

nested_params.name: Analysis
nested_params.description: The Add On ARN and its returned value to evaluate in a string condition expression.

nested_params.name: Analyzer
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Add On.

nested_params.name: ResultField
nested_params.description: The returned value from an Add On.

nested_params.name: Attribute
nested_params.description: The email attribute to evaluate in a string condition expression.

nested_params.name: MimeHeaderAttribute
nested_params.description: The email MIME X-Header attribute to evaluate in a string condition expression.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The matching operator for a string condition expression.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: The string(s) to be evaluated in a string condition expression. For all operators, except for NOT_EQUALS, if multiple values are given, the values are processed as an OR. That is, if any of the values match the email's string using the given operator, the condition is deemed to match. However, for NOT_EQUALS, the condition is only deemed to match if none of the given strings match the email's string.

nested_params.name: VerdictExpression
nested_params.description: The condition applies to a verdict expression passed in this field.

nested_params.name: Evaluate
nested_params.description: The verdict to evaluate in a verdict condition expression.

nested_params.name: Analysis
nested_params.description: The Add On ARN and its returned value to evaluate in a verdict condition expression.

nested_params.name: Analyzer
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Add On.

nested_params.name: ResultField
nested_params.description: The returned value from an Add On.

nested_params.name: Attribute
nested_params.description: The email verdict attribute to evaluate in a string verdict expression.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The matching operator for a verdict condition expression.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: The values to match with the email's verdict using the given operator. For the EQUALS operator, if multiple values are given, the condition is deemed to match if any of the given verdicts match that of the email. For the NOT_EQUALS operator, if multiple values are given, the condition is deemed to match of none of the given verdicts match the verdict of the email.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for the resource. For example, { 'tags': {'key1':'value1', 'key2':'value2'} }. (dict) --- A key-value pair (the value is optional), that you can define and assign to Amazon Web Services resources. The key of the key-value tag. The value of the key-value tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the key-value tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the key-value tag.

nested_items.name: RuleSetId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the created rule set.
